title: The Spy (1917 German film)
text:
The Spy (German: Der Spion) is a 1917 German <a href="silent%20film">silent</a> <a href="war%20film">war</a> <a href="espionage%20film">espionage film</a> directed by <a href="Karl%20Heiland">Karl Heiland</a> and starring <a href="Ferdinand%20Bonn">Ferdinand Bonn</a>, <a href="Ellen%20Richter">Ellen Richter</a> and <a href="Conrad%20Veidt">Conrad Veidt</a>. It was made as a <a href="propaganda%20film">propaganda film</a> to support the German war effort during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>. It is now considered a <a href="lost%20film">lost film</a>.
It was shot around <a href="Cologne">Cologne</a> and <a href="%20D%C3%BCsseldorf"> Düsseldorf</a>.
Synopsis.
An Italian spy enters the <a href="German%20Empire">German Empire</a> in an attempt to commit sabotage and steal secret documents from a large <a href="armaments">armaments</a> factory.
